title: RIP Brompton Superlight: Brompton launches new lightweight P Line folding bike
content:
Emma Cole
18 Nov 2021

A lightweight 4-speed Brompton with all the appeal of the traditional folding bike

Brompton today launches the Brompton P Line, a lightweight, sturdy folding bike designed to offer better handling and control. The updated version features much of the same familiar makeup as the previous Brompton Superlight, but the P Line offers a lighter, faster ride with refined key elements.

The update comes as Brompton simplified the rest of its product naming system in October 2021. The P Line joins the A Line, C Line and Electric C Line – for full details don't miss our buyer's guide to the Brompton range.

Weighing a claimed 9.65kg (1.95kg less than the A Line), the P Line is made from a combination of titanium and steel and can be folded into a package measuring 645mm × 585mm × 270mm.

The rear frame and fork are made from titanium, weighing a claimed 700g less than the all-steel equivalent, and comes with a redesigned suspension block (the polyurethane bushing that provides rear end squish) which Brompton says helps improve control and handling performance. Essential for navigating commuters glued to their phones?

The updated lightweight bike has a newly developed 4-speed freehub body, and a rear derailleur weighing a claimed 60g. According to the brand this provides a similar ratio to its popular C Line 3-speed bikes and 60% more than the 2-speed A Line bike.

The P Line also features a dual locking seatpost system which has two positions, either fully down which is ideal for storing, or halfway up which is meant for making it easy to transport the bike around a city.

For visibility, the P Line has front and rear reflectors, a USB rechargeable Brompton 500 lumen front light, and a standard battery powered rear light.

The P Line is available with three types of handlebars – low, mid and high – three different seatpost lengths, and three tyre options.

The bike is available in either Storm Grey or Midnight Black.

With prices starting at £2,100, the Brompton P Line comes in at the higher price bracket of the brand's range but its lightweight, nifty features should go some way to justifying the extra outlay.
